bradleyross.library.helpers

Class SpreadsheetHelpers

  • java.lang.Object
    • bradleyross.library.helpers.SpreadsheetHelpers

  • public class SpreadsheetHelpers
extends Object
    Generates an Excel XML workbook.
    Author:
    Bradley Ross
    See Also:
    TestSpreadsheetHelpers

    • Method Detail

      • setDebugLevel

        public void setDebugLevel(int level)
        Set amount of diagnostic messages to be printed.

        A value of 0 indicates that a normal level diagnostic messages are to be printed. Increased values increase the quantity of diagnostic messages, while negative numbers reduce the amount of messages.

        Parameters:
        level - Desired level of diagnostic messages.

      • getDebugLevel

        public int getDebugLevel()
        Returns value of debugLevel
        Returns:
        Value of debugLevel
        See Also:
        debugLevel, setDebugLevel(int)

        Parameters:

        fileName - Name of file to be generated

      • startWorkbook

        public String startWorkbook()
        Returns the character string that should appear at the start of the workbook.

        Some of the literal values in the listing below should probably be replaced with calculated values, particularly the date and time of the creation of the document.

        Returns:
        Text for start of workbook

      • startWorksheet

        private String startWorksheet(String worksheetName,
                    int numRows,
                    int numCols)
        Generate the XML text to appear at the start of a spreadsheet within the workbook.
        Parameters:
        worksheetName - Name of spreadsheet
        numRows - Number of rows in spreadsheet
        numCols - Number of columns in spreadsheet
        Returns:
        XML text for start of spreadsheet

      • endWorksheet

        private String endWorksheet()
        Generate the XML text to appear at the end of a spreadsheet within the workbook.
        Returns:
        XML code to end spreadsheet

      • generateWorksheetHeader

        protected String generateWorksheetHeader(ResultSet rs,
                             ResultSetMetaData meta,
                             String columns)
                                  throws SQLException
        Generate header line for spreadsheet.

        Overriding this method should allow the contents of the header line to be changed as desired.

        This method is normally called from the newWorksheet methods.

        Parameters:
        rs - Result Set from SQL query
        meta - ResultSetMetaData from SQL query
        columns - XML statements specifying formatting of columns
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • newWorksheet

        public String newWorksheet(String worksheetName,
                  ResultSet rs)
                    throws SQLException
        Use the contents of a ResultSet to create an Excel spreadsheet.
        Parameters:
        worksheetName - Name to be used for Excel spreadsheet.
        rs - ResultSet object to be used.
        Returns:
        XML source for Excel spreadsheet
        Throws:
        SQLException
        See Also:
        newWorksheet(String, ResultSet, String)

      • newWorksheet

        public String newWorksheet(String worksheetName,
                  ResultSet rs,
                  String columns)
                    throws SQLException
        Use the contents of a ResultSet to create an Excel spreadsheet. This version allows the width of the columns to be set by the calling program.
        Parameters:
        worksheetName - Name to be used for Excel spreadsheet
        rs - ResultSet object to be used
        columns - String to be inserted into spreadsheet to define widths of columns
        Returns:
        XML source for Excel spreadsheet
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • newWorksheet

        public String newWorksheet(String worksheetName,
                  ResultSet rs,
                  String columns,
                  int breakColumn)
                    throws SQLException
        Use the contents of a ResultSet to create an Excel worksheet. This version allows the width of the columns to be set by the calling program.
        Parameters:
        worksheetName - Name to be used for Excel worksheet
        rs - ResultSet object to be used
        columns - String to be inserted into spreadsheet to define widths of columns
        breakColumn - This is the number of the column that will be used for bursting the report
        Returns:
        XML source for Excel spreadsheet
        Throws:
        SQLException
        See Also:
        newWorksheet(String, ResultSet), newWorksheet(String, ResultSet, String)

      • newWorksheet

        public String newWorksheet(String worksheetName,
                  File inputFile)
        Use the contents of a file to create an Excel worksheet.
        Parameters:
        worksheetName - Name of worksheet to be created.
        inputFile - Name of file to be read
        Returns:
        XML string containing Excel worksheet

      • newWorksheet

        public String newWorksheet(String worksheetName,
                  String input)
        Use the contents of a String object to create an Excel spreadsheet.
        Parameters:
        worksheetName - Name of spreadsheet to be created.
        input - String object to be read
        Returns:
        XML string containing Excel spreadsheet
